brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design embraces a minimalist and modern aesthetic characterized by spacious layouts, clean typography, and a restrained pastel color palette. The primary background colors are soft off-whites and pale blues, creating a calm and inviting canvas. Text and interactive elements predominantly use a deep navy blue, ensuring strong contrast and readability. Accent colors in subtle pastel purple and yellow appear in small UI elements, adding gentle vibrancy without overwhelming the design. Typography is geometric sans-serif, with large, bold headings paired with lighter, well-spaced body text to enhance clarity and hierarchy. The layout employs modular grids with generous negative space, balancing text and iconography in a harmonious, user-friendly manner. Buttons are solid, rounded rectangles with dark backgrounds and white text, emphasizing clear calls to action. Overall, the design conveys professionalism, approachability, and efficiency, making it highly adaptable for educational platforms, professional services, and technology brands seeking a clean and trustworthy online presence.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, approachable, clear, and trustworthy with a calm and efficient personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'background' color as the primary canvas for all pages to maintain a clean and calm atmosphere. The 'primary' color should be reserved for main text, headings, and key interactive elements such as buttons and links, paired with 'primaryForeground' for text on these elements to ensure readability. The 'secondary' color and its 'secondaryForeground' are ideal for subtle UI accents, secondary buttons, and category tags, providing gentle contrast without overpowering the primary content. Custom colors like 'softYellowAccent' and 'lightPurpleAccent' are best used sparingly for highlighting informational badges, icons, or subtle background gradients to add visual interest while preserving the minimalist tone. This palette ensures accessibility and visual harmony, supporting a professional and approachable brand presence.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primary' color (#1E254E) on 'background' (#F7F9FF) achieves excellent contrast exceeding WCAG AA standards for both normal and large text. Buttons using 'primary' with 'primaryForeground' (#FFFFFF) also meet AAA contrast requirements. The 'secondary' color (#A59FE6) on 'background' provides sufficient contrast for UI accents and secondary text, meeting WCAG AA for large text. Custom colors 'softYellowAccent' and 'lightPurpleAccent' are used in small UI elements and backgrounds where contrast requirements are less stringent but should be paired with 'primary' or 'primaryForeground' text to maintain readability and accessibility compliance.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all major titles and section headers to establish clear content hierarchy. Headings should be large and bold with ample spacing to enhance readability and visual impact. Pair headings with the paragraph font to create a balanced typographic rhythm. Ensure headings use the 'primary' color for maximum contrast against the 'background'. Maintain consistent letter spacing and line height to preserve clarity across devices and screen sizes.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'background' meet WCAG AAA contrast standards, ensuring excellent readability for all users.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body copy, descriptions, and supporting text. Maintain a lighter font weight and moderate size to ensure comfortable reading. Paragraph text should use the 'primary' color or a slightly lighter shade if needed for secondary information, always ensuring sufficient contrast with the 'background'. Combine with headings to create a clear typographic hierarchy and consistent user experience. Line height and letter spacing should be optimized for legibility on all screen sizes.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'primary' color on 'background' meets WCAG AA contrast requirements for normal text, supporting accessibility and readability.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section typography is anchored in the bottom third of the layout, creating a grounded and approachable introduction. Large, bold headings occupy the lower left quadrant, balanced by supporting text and call-to-action buttons placed nearby with ample negative space. This placement draws the eye naturally from the headline to the action, leveraging the spacious layout and clean typography to create a welcoming and clear entry point for users.

components.containers: Containers use subtle rounded corners and light backgrounds with gentle shadows or borders to separate content blocks. They maintain consistent padding and spacing to preserve the clean and spacious feel. Background colors often use 'background' or custom pastel accents to differentiate sections without overwhelming the user.
components.images: Images are used sparingly and are well-integrated with text content, often aligned to the right or left of text blocks. They maintain natural proportions and are framed with generous white space to avoid clutter. Image treatments are minimal, focusing on clarity and relevance.
components.buttons: Buttons are solid with rounded corners, primarily using the 'primary' color for backgrounds and 'primaryForeground' for text. Secondary buttons use lighter backgrounds with 'secondary' color text and borders. Buttons have clear hover states and sufficient padding for easy interaction.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimalistic, line-based, and use the 'primary' or 'secondary' colors depending on context. They are small, simple, and consistent in style, supporting content without distraction.
graphicElements.illustrations: Illustrations are minimal or absent in the UI, with the design favoring photographic or video content where applicable. When present, they use the custom pastel colors to maintain harmony.
graphicElements.stickers: Stickers or badges are small, color-coded UI elements using 'softYellowAccent' or 'lightPurpleAccent' to categorize or highlight content. They have rounded corners and subtle shadows to stand out gently.

brandIdentity.designSummary: This design features a modern, high-contrast aesthetic with a minimalistic yet bold approach. The primary color palette revolves around a vivid orange accent paired with deep charcoal black and clean white backgrounds, creating a dynamic and professional atmosphere. Typography is geometric and sans-serif, emphasizing clarity and technical sophistication. The layout is grid-based and modular, with generous spacing and clear hierarchical numbering to guide users through content logically. UI components such as buttons and cards are minimalistic with subtle shadows and rounded corners, reinforcing a sleek and contemporary feel. The overall visual personality is that of a cutting-edge technology brand, conveying trustworthiness, innovation, and expertise.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Authoritative, innovative, and professional with a focus on precision and clarity.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: The color system is defined by a stark contrast between the 'background' and the 'secondary' color. Use the 'secondary' color to create immersive, full-width sections that house technical capabilities or feature lists, using 'secondaryForeground' for all typography within these zones. The 'background' color serves as the canvas for standard content, research data, and card-based layouts, paired with the 'foreground' color for text. The 'primary' color is the brand's 'safety signal'; use it exclusively for high-impact visual anchors such as numbered badges, active navigation states, or primary call-to-action buttons. Do not overuse the 'primary' color for large backgrounds. Use 'surfaceDark' for container elements that sit on top of the 'secondary' background to create subtle depth. The 'divider' color should be used for the thin, precise horizontal lines that structure the content.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The combination of 'background' and 'foreground' provides excellent contrast (AAA). Similarly, 'secondary' and 'secondaryForeground' offer high contrast suitable for all text sizes. The 'primary' color with 'primaryForeground' generally meets minimum contrast requirements for large text or graphical UI components (like the numbered badges shown) but may fall short of WCAG AA for small body text; therefore, avoid using 'primary' as a background for fine print. Ensure that any text placed on 'surfaceDark' maintains sufficient lightness to stand out.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all major titles and section headers to establish hierarchy and clarity. Headings should be bold and sized prominently to contrast with body text. Pair headings with the paragraph font to maintain a cohesive and professional look. Adequate spacing above and below headings ensures readability and visual separation. Use the 'primary' color for numbering and accent elements near headings to reinforce brand identity.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings use high contrast colors such as 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds or black on 'background' to meet WCAG AA standards for large text, ensuring clear readability.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, descriptions, and smaller informational content. Maintain sufficient line height and letter spacing for comfortable reading. Paragraph text should contrast strongly with the background, using 'secondaryForeground' on dark backgrounds and black or dark gray on light backgrounds. Avoid using the 'primary' color for large blocks of text to preserve readability and focus the accent color on interactive or key elements.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text colors maintain WCAG AA contrast ratios against their backgrounds, ensuring accessibility for all users.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section uses a large, bold heading anchored in the top third of the viewport, overlaying a full-width hero image. The heading is left-aligned with ample padding, creating a strong focal point. Supporting text is placed nearby with smaller font size and lighter weight, maintaining hierarchy. The placement balances visual impact with readability, leveraging negative space around the text to avoid clutter and emphasize the brand message.

components.containers: Containers use solid backgrounds of either 'background' or 'secondary' colors with subtle shadows and rounded corners to create separation and depth. Content is well padded and spaced to maintain clarity and hierarchy. Number badges in 'primary' color are used to label sections and items, adding visual interest and aiding navigation.
components.images: Images are used prominently in hero sections with full-width layouts and overlay text. They are industrial and technical in tone but do not influence the core color palette. Images have no borders and are integrated seamlessly into the layout.
components.buttons: Buttons are minimalistic with a solid 'primary' background and 'primaryForeground' text for primary actions. Secondary buttons use transparent backgrounds with 'primary' colored borders and text. Buttons have subtle rounded corners and consistent padding, maintaining a clean and modern look.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are simple, line-based, and use the 'primary' color for emphasis. They maintain a consistent stroke weight and style, supporting the technical and modern aesthetic.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are present; the design relies on photography and clean UI elements.
graphicElements.stickers: Number badges and small labels use the 'primary' color with white text, featuring rounded corners and consistent sizing to create a cohesive visual language.

brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design features a modern, minimalistic aesthetic with a strong emphasis on grid-based structure and high contrast. The primary colors are black and white, providing a clean and professional backdrop, while vibrant orange and soft lavender gradients serve as accent colors to highlight key interactive elements and create visual interest. Typography is monospaced and typewriter-inspired, reinforcing a technical and coding-related theme. The layout is modular and asymmetrical, using clear columns and rows with visible grid lines to evoke a sense of precision and order. UI components such as buttons are sharp-edged and functional, primarily using the 'secondary' orange color for calls to action. The overall visual personality is futuristic, energetic, and tech-savvy, suitable for technology conferences or digital product showcases.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, innovative, precise, and energetic with a tech-savvy and modern personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' black color predominantly for backgrounds and large text blocks to create strong contrast with the 'primaryForeground' white text. The 'secondary' orange color is reserved for call-to-action buttons, highlights, and interactive elements, paired with 'secondaryForeground' black text for readability. The 'lavenderGradientStart' and 'lavenderGradientEnd' colors form a smooth gradient used in large background blocks and overlays to add a modern, digital feel without overwhelming the design. The 'gridLine' color is used subtly for background grid lines to reinforce the structured, technical aesthetic. These colors should be combined thoughtfully to maintain accessibility and visual hierarchy, ensuring that text and interactive elements stand out clearly against their backgrounds.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' white text on 'primary' black background meets WCAG AAA contrast standards for all text sizes. The 'secondaryForeground' black text on 'secondary' orange background meets WCAG AA standards for normal text and AAA for large text. The lavender gradient colors provide sufficient contrast when used with black text for headings and body copy. The 'gridLine' color is light and used only for non-interactive background elements, ensuring no accessibility issues.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the 'azeret-mono' font for all headings to maintain a consistent, technical aesthetic. Headings should be uppercase or sentence case with generous letter spacing to enhance readability and emphasize the futuristic tone. Pair headings with paragraph text in the same font family but smaller size to maintain harmony. Use the 'primary' and 'secondary' colors for headings depending on background context to ensure strong contrast and accessibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'azeret-mono' with 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds meet WCAG AAA contrast standards, ensuring clear readability.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the same 'azeret-mono' font for paragraphs to maintain a cohesive and minimalistic style. Body text should be smaller with normal letter spacing and line height optimized for readability. Use 'primary' or 'secondary' colors for text depending on background to maintain contrast. Avoid overly long lines by using grid-based layout and spacing. This font pairing supports the technical and modern brand tone.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'azeret-mono' with 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds meets WCAG AA standards for normal text and AAA for large text.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome or hero section uses large, bold headings anchored in the top third of the viewport, creating immediate visual impact. The text is left-aligned with generous spacing, supported by a modular grid layout. Accent colors from the palette highlight key phrases or calls to action, while the background uses gradient blocks to add depth without distracting from the typography.

components.containers: Containers use solid backgrounds in 'background' white or gradient blocks from 'lavenderGradientStart' to 'lavenderGradientEnd'. They maintain consistent padding and margin to preserve the grid structure. Borders or outlines use the 'gridLine' color subtly to define sections without clutter.
components.images: Images are black and white portraits with clean edges, integrated into the grid with consistent sizing. They maintain a professional and minimalistic style, complementing the monospaced typography and overall tech theme.
components.buttons: Buttons are rectangular with sharp edges, primarily filled with the 'secondary' orange color and text in 'secondaryForeground' black. Secondary buttons may use transparent backgrounds with orange borders and black text. Buttons have consistent padding and are sized to be easily clickable, emphasizing calls to action.

graphicElements.icons: Icons, if used, would be minimalistic, line-based, and monochromatic, primarily using 'primaryForeground' white or 'secondary' orange for emphasis. They align with the monospaced, technical aesthetic.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are present; the design relies on geometric shapes and gradients for visual interest.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are used, maintaining a clean and professional look.

brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design features a minimalistic and modern aesthetic with a strong emphasis on clarity and spaciousness. The color palette is dominated by a deep navy blue as the primary color, complemented by white backgrounds and subtle lighter blue gradients in abstract shapes. Typography is clean, geometric sans-serif, balancing professionalism with approachability. The layout is modular and column-based, with generous whitespace and clear visual hierarchy. Rounded corners and soft edges on images and containers add a smooth, contemporary feel. Buttons are distinctly styled with solid and outlined navy blue variants, supporting clear call-to-actions. Overall, the design conveys a forward-thinking, reliable, and user-friendly technology or IT solutions brand identity.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, trustworthy, innovative, and approachable with a modern and clean personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color for main interactive elements such as primary buttons, icons, and key text to establish brand recognition and trust. The 'primaryForeground' color is reserved for text and icons placed on 'primary' backgrounds to ensure readability. The 'secondary' color, which is white, serves as the base background to maintain a clean and spacious feel, with 'secondaryForeground' used for text and icons on white backgrounds to maintain strong contrast. The 'gradientLightBlue' and 'gradientMediumBlue' custom colors are used in abstract background shapes and imagery to add depth and a futuristic touch without overwhelming the interface. The 'buttonOutline' color is used for secondary buttons and borders, providing subtle emphasis while maintaining a minimal look. This palette ensures accessibility and a cohesive visual experience across the website.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' color combination meets WCAG AA standards for text and icon contrast, ensuring readability. The 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' background also meets WCAG AA contrast ratios for body text and headings. The use of white as the 'secondary' background maximizes contrast and clarity. Gradient colors are used decoratively and do not contain critical text, maintaining accessibility compliance.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all major titles and section headers to establish hierarchy and clarity. Headings should be bold or semi-bold with ample spacing to maintain readability and visual balance with paragraph text. Pair headings with the paragraph font to create a harmonious typographic system. Use the 'primary' color for headings to emphasize importance and maintain brand consistency.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'secondary' background meet WCAG AA contrast requirements, ensuring clear legibility for users with visual impairments.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, descriptions, and smaller informational text. Maintain consistent line height and letter spacing for optimal readability. Paragraph text should primarily use the 'secondaryForeground' color to ensure contrast against the 'secondary' background. Combine with headings to create a clear typographic hierarchy and a cohesive reading experience.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' background meets WCAG AA contrast standards for body copy, supporting accessibility.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section places the main headline and call-to-action in the lower third of the hero image area, aligned left with ample whitespace around. This placement draws the eye naturally from the top left, balancing the large abstract image on the right. The text uses the 'primary' color for contrast against the light gradient background, ensuring readability. The call-to-action button is positioned below the text, clearly visible and inviting interaction. This layout creates a calm, focused introduction to the brand.

components.containers: Containers have a clean white background with subtle rounded corners and consistent padding, creating distinct content blocks without heavy borders. This approach maintains a light and open feel while organizing content clearly. The use of white backgrounds supports the 'secondary' color role, ensuring content stands out.
components.images: Images are abstract, softly blurred, and use gradient blue tones with rounded corners that echo container shapes. This treatment integrates images seamlessly into the design, reinforcing the futuristic and tech-oriented brand identity without distraction.
components.buttons: Primary buttons use a solid 'primary' navy blue background with white text for strong call-to-action emphasis. Secondary buttons have a white background with a 'buttonOutline' navy border and text, providing a subtle alternative action style. Buttons have rounded corners consistent with container and image shapes, maintaining visual harmony.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, line-based, and use the 'primary' navy blue color. They are simple and consistent, supporting clarity and user guidance without visual clutter.
graphicElements.illustrations: No traditional illustrations are used; instead, abstract gradient shapes and softly blurred images serve as visual interest elements, reinforcing the modern and innovative brand tone.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are present, maintaining the clean and minimal aesthetic.

brandBook.toneOfVoice: Professional, approachable, clear, and trustworthy with a calm and efficient personality.

components.buttons: Buttons are solid with rounded corners, primarily using the 'primary' color for backgrounds and 'primaryForeground' for text. components.containers: Containers use subtle rounded corners and light backgrounds with gentle shadows or borders to separate content blocks. initialPrompt: A web application called Dynamic Documentation Helper  Real-Time RAG System. It provides a real-time AI documentation assistant that updates its knowledge instantly when documents in a connected Google Drive folder are added, edited, or deleted. The system uses a live data pipeline with Google Drive, Pathway, text extraction, chunking, OpenAI embeddings, ChromaDB, and a Flask web UI. It supports PDF, TXT, and Google Docs files, and always answers questions based on the latest document versions, showing sources and update times in a modern, tech-themed interface.
